answers.answer: They might induce you early. I have hypertension at 34 weeks, and they are running more tests on me to see if I have preeclampsia. She said I should expect to be induced at 37-38 weeks, and also us monitoring me quite closely.
When my doctor though I had it with my daughter around 34 weeks he said if i did have it I would need to be induced and postie c section by 36 weeks.

With my pregnancy with my daughter i was diagnosed with preeclampsia. They induced me at 35 weeks and the entire time i was in labor they ran magnesium sulfate through my IV. By far the worst labor i could ever imagined having. The doctors and nurses came in just about every hour until i delivered and kept continually montering me. I was not allowed to eat or drink anything at all until 24 hours after i delivered. I would talk to your doctor and see their protocol on preeclampsia because its definitely not something to get blind sided into like i was. Hope all goes well!

question: What will doctors do if you are diagnosed with preeclamsia at week 36?
title: Preeclamsia?
